DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks if written informed consent has been obtained from a patient.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: the patient's signature to consent to participate in various research activities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; an identifying feature or characteristic of something or someone; an alternative term for motif or pattern; the part of the prescription that contains directions to the patient for taking of medicine.:Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Individual's name or personal mark, used to sign documents and employed to signify that the writing which precedes accords with one's wishes and intentions; having a handwritten signature.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has written informed consent
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has written informed consent been obtained?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient willing and able to understand and sign the informed consent form and for individuals under the age of 18, the parental/guardian assent form?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the subject willing and able to understand and sign the informed consent form and for individuals under the age of 18, the parental/guardian assent form?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient willing and able to provide written informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: 9117 Inclusion Criteria
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has a signed infomed consent/assen/durable power of attorney (DPA) been obtained by the patient or parent/legal guardian

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ability to understand and the willingness to sign a written informed consent document

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6685
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the participant willing to provide a written informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6702
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was the informed consent obtained from the patient?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alternate Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient able to understand and is willing to sign a written informed consent document?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6690
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant provided a written informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN Standard
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the participant been provided written and oral consent information and consented to participate in the study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has the ability to understand, and the willingness to sign, a written informed consent document.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient and/or his/her parent(s) or legal guardian(s) signed an informed consent form for the APEC14B1 CCDI Molecular Characterization Initiative?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has written informed consent been obtained?
